Definition: You will be given a piece of text either about an everyday event, or a general statement. If the event seems a plausible event to you, or the general statement makes sense matches your commonsense, output 'True', otherwise output 'False'.

Positive Examples.input: The glass fell of a three-story building, so it broke into pieces.
Positive Examples.explanation: Falling down from a considerable height causes glasses to break, so this is a true sentence.

Positive Examples.input: Marry was going out to work, so she asked her sixteen-year-old daughter to take care of her five-year-old son.
Positive Examples.explanation: It makes sense to ask a teenage person to take care of their child sibling, so this is a true sentence.

Positive Examples.input: Johnathan didn't have a hammer, so he used a cotton pad to drive the nail into the wood.
Positive Examples.explanation: This sentence is not true, because cotton pads are soft and therefore can not be proper substitutes for hammers.

Positive Examples.input: Suraya's best friend is getting married soon, so she will likely choose to go on a trip instead of helping her friend organize the ceremony.
Positive Examples.explanation: This sentence is not true, because people tend to help their best friends when they have a big event, like a wedding, coming soon.

Negative Examples.input: For the twenty guests Sam was going to have over for dinner, she ordered two small pizzas.
Negative Examples.explanation: Two small pizzas is not enough dinner for twenty people, so this sentence is not true.

Negative Examples.input: Ali has decided to get up early from now on, so he is likely to go to bed later than before.
Negative Examples.explanation: People are likely to go to bed earlier if they want to get up sooner, so this sentence is not true.

Negative Examples.input: Jacob lives a 15-minute drive away from his office, so in order to be on-time for his 8 am meeting, he should leave home by 7:45.
Negative Examples.explanation: Given the 15 minute driving time to a place, one should leave at least 15 minute before an event to catch it on-time, so this sentence is true.

Negative Examples.input: My smart neighbour adviced me to use a paper tape to fix the hole in my bath tub.
Negative Examples.explanation: Bath tubs are filled with water and a paper tape will dissolve in a bath tub, so a smart person would not give such an advice.

Negative Examples.input: After a year of consistent practice, Jennifer was able to run a marathon.
Negative Examples.explanation: The output should be either 'True' or 'False'.
